intro: Heterapithmos floribunda, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. Heterapithmos floribunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its vibrant blooms and relatively low maintenance requirements.
